attributes.action: Solve the current housing crisis by forcing local authorities to approve self-build developments
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The UK has a projected housing deficit of 4.4 million dwellings.

This problem could be easily solved by forcing local authorities to approve planning permission for self-build properties.

Rough calculation:
Housing Deficit=4.4M,
UK Population = 60M,
Dewllings needed per 1000 pop=7.3,
Properties per hectare = 100,
Hectares needed per 1000 pop = 0.73,
Hectares to be released in Esses = 100,
Area of Essex=350000 hectares,
% of Essex needed = 0.3%

Self-build houses are significantly cheaper and 'greener' than developed properties, thus this proposal would also negate the need for affordable housing policies. 

Though this would involve developing the countyside, a blot on the landscape it is preferable to having a generation of homeless pensioners who are unable to afford their rent.
